name: Rolling 12-Month Forecast
description: Build and update a rolling 12-month financial forecast incorporating latest actuals, updated assumptions, and business intelligence. Provides forward-looking visibility for resource allocation and strategic decisions.

currentProcess.description: Roll forward prior forecast model and update actuals
painPoints: Complex Excel models prone to errors

currentProcess.description: Gather updated assumptions from business partners
painPoints: Late or missing inputs delay the process
Complex revenue models with many variables
New initiatives not yet in model

currentProcess.description: Build cash flow and balance sheet forecasts
Create forecast summary and variance to prior forecast
painPoints: Bridge from prior forecast to current

aiProcess.description: Analyze historical patterns and suggest driver updates
aiProcess.toolRationale: Gemini identifies trends and anomalies in historical data
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Trend analysis with suggested driver adjustments

aiProcess.description: Generate assumption template for business partners
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Standardized assumption request for each department
tips: Include prior period values as starting point

aiProcess.description: Collect assumptions and update model (manual + AI)
aiProcess.toolRationale: Human coordination needed; AI assists with data integration
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Updated forecast model with new assumptions

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude can reason about which variables to flex and how much
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Base, upside, downside scenarios with variable settings
tips: Specify which variables are most uncertain

aiProcess.expectedOutput: Forecast summary with bridge to prior forecast

aiProcess.description: Run scenarios in model and compile results (manual)
aiProcess.toolRationale: Manual model work; AI helped define scenarios
Human review critical; AI helps with iterations

whyItMatters: Rolling forecasts provide continuous forward visibility, replacing static annual budgets with dynamic planning. They enable faster reallocation of resources and reduce the 'budget game' where actuals are always compared to outdated plans.
commonMistakes: Updating numbers without updating assumptions - creates inconsistency
Treating forecast as 'budget 2.0' - it should reflect current best estimate, not targets
Not documenting assumption changes - makes variance analysis impossible
Building scenarios that aren't internally consistent
Over-engineering the model - simpler models are easier to update
tips: Use AI to identify which assumptions drive the most variance
Ask AI to pressure-test your assumptions: 'What would need to be true for this forecast?'
Create a standard assumption collection template - consistency speeds the process
Build scenario generation prompts you can reuse each month
sources: Gartner FP&A Research - Planning cycle optimization
